column3: This changes the accounting to include the local node, which is probably incorrect\n

@jgarzik are you sure? I thought my edit simply added a printf, but doesn't change the logic. I've just double-check. Yup, it doesn't change the way local nodes are treated, it just reports when it happens now.\n
nMisbehavior increment was moved prior to the IsLocal() test, changing behavior.\n
NACK because of the nMisbehavior change, we don't want IsLocal nodes getting banned.\n
ACK, if/when the "nMisbehavior += howmuch;" line is moved back to its original position.\n
Ah. Sorry, yes, @jgarzik, I do see what you mean now. I shall move the nMishehavior line back to its original location. Doing so now.\n

Ok. Now updated. The only change now is the printfs, and the change of nMisbehaviour is no longer moved. This move would not have changed anything though, as the only place where the value is read is in this function, and it's only acted upon if the peer is NOT local, so the treatment of local nodes did remain the same, other than the value of nMisbehaviour changing but not being acted upon.\n
Can you throw in a flag in this line that says DISCONNECTING or something?\n

There is already a line that says when it disconnects, so with this patch, you'll see the Misbehaving: (80 -> 100), followed by a line that says disconnecting. It can be derived that the disconnection was for misbehaviour as the two lines would be together, and the Misbehaving number would clearly have reached 100 (or higher).\n
Can those 2 be merged into 1 line without breaking any other important infos? Would be a nice thing.\n
